pages.text: The Teddy Bear A-B-C By Laura Rinkle Johnson Illustrated by Margaret Landers Sanford
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 1

pages.text: The Teddy Bear ABC by Laura Rinkle Johnson Illustrated by Margaret Landers Sanford H.M. CALDWELL Co. Boston - Publishers - New York
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 7

pages.text: Copyright 1907 by H. M. Caldwell Co.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 8

pages.text: A IS for Animal, The one which I mean, If you read the next rhyme Will surely be seen.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 10

pages.text: B IS for Bears That these rhymes are about; The children all greet them With clamor and shout.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 12

pages.text: C IS for Cub - The bear's baby, you know; He hides in his fright As she beats off the foe.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 14

pages.text: D IS for Den, 'Tis a cave in the hill, The cubs sleep inside it, All curled up so still.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 16

pages.text: E IS for Eskimo, In his cold northern home; He lives where the shaggy Polar bears roam.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 18

pages.text: F IS for Fish That are caught through the ice; The bears eat them raw, And think them quite nice.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 20

tags.term: is the bear in power or not in this book

pages.text: G IS for Grizzly, How wicked he looks; As he frightens the dollies, And gnaws at the books!
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 22

pages.text: H IS for Honey, Stored safe in a tree; Ted gobbles the sweetmeat, And sometimes the bee!
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 24

pages.text: I IS for Indian, The bear's stealthy foe; To kill the big bruin, Far, far will he go.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 26

pages.text: J IS for Journey The Teddy Bears took; Their story is told In a large handsome book.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 28

pages.text: K IS for Kitty With buttons for eyes; Poor Teddy is terrified At her great size.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 30

pages.text: L IS for Lazy, A trait of the beast; He will snooze in the dish At the end of a feast.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 32

pages.text: M IS for Milk, Which tame cubs like to drink; Teddy takes his at ease, A good scheme, I think.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 34

pages.text: N IS for Nuts On which the bears dine; If they have to go hungry, They set up a whine.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 36

pages.text: O IS for Ostrich-tips All ladies wear, In the front row of fashion Is Old Mother Bear.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 38

pages.text: P IS for Pie Made of berries so sweet, All sprinkled with sugar For bear babes to eat.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 40

pages.text: Q IS for Quiet That reigns in the wood, While the bears sleep all winter Without any food.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 42

pages.text: R IS for Rompers Of cloth colored blue; Teddy wears one when dressed, And a ribbon bow too.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 44

pages.text: S IS Sweet Apples That bears like to eat; They don't care for sour ones, But are fond of the sweet.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 46

pages.text: T IS for Teddy The name we all know Belongs to the Bruins Wherever they go.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 48

pages.text: U IS Umbrella To keep off the rain; The rent in the cover Gives Teddy great pain.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 50

pages.text: V IS Vexation Which Teddy Bears cause, When my dollies they squeeze With their strong furry paws
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 52

pages.text: W IS for Wagon With three bears as crew; One fell out behind, And then there were two.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 54

pages.text: X STANDS for Ten Teddy Bears in their might. Their brave Captain leads them, - They long for the fight.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 56

pages.text: Y IS for Yuletide, The grown people's name For the time when my Teddy From Santa Claus came.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 58

pages.text: Z IS for Zoo, With poor Bears in a cage, They dream of the woods, And no wonder they rage.
pages.title: The Teddy Bear ABC, Page 60
